ETYMOLOGY: From Old English 'þing' (assembly, meeting, matter, business, act, event, object), from Proto-Germanic '*þingą' (assembly, meeting), from Proto-Indo-European '*tenk-' (to come, to meet).

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: noun: a word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or objects, or to name a particular one of these.
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: Please put your things away after you've used them.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 请用完后把你的东西收好。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: noun: a word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or objects, or to name a particular one of these.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A fact, idea, situation, or action; an event or matter.
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The first thing we need to do is organize a meeting.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 我们首先要做的事情是组织一次会议。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: noun: a word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or objects, or to name a particular one of these.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: Used to refer to a creature or person, especially in a general, often affectionate or pitying, way.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 某人；某物（指人或动物，常用于亲昵或怜悯的称呼）
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The poor little thing looked so scared and lost.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 那个可怜的小家伙看起来又害怕又迷茫。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: noun: a word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or objects, or to name a particular one of these.
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: I've packed all my things for the trip.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 我已将旅行所需的所有物品打包好了。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: idiom: a group of words established by usage as having a meaning not deducible from those of the individual words.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A strong liking, interest, or enthusiasm for something or someone.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 对…有特别的喜好；痴迷于…
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: She's always had a thing for vintage cars.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 她一直都对老爷车情有独钟。

MEANINGS.PATTERN: how are things | the way things are
MEANINGS.POS_TIP: noun phrase: a phrase functioning as a noun.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: The general state of affairs or circumstances.
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: How are things going at work these days?

REGISTER: Very common and versatile; ranges from formal to informal depending on context and accompanying phrases.
